As of 31 March in the Western Australia region "Level 1" measures are in effect which has eased travel but enforces restrictions against travel to Aboriginal communities. To help keep remote Aboriginal communities safe from COVID-19, there are strict travel restrictions in place. Tourists and travellers are not allowed to enter. Vaccination status does not affect this restriction.     Under the WA Governmentâs Remote Aboriginal Communities Directions, the only people who can enter a remote Aboriginal community are residents of those communities and those who are:  - providing essential services and supplies  - going to work or school there  - entering for family or cultural reasons  - delivering a community program or activity  - entering in an emergency.
